Esau can use given conjunctions with 21% accuracy. 

A coordinating conjunction is a word that combines two words, phrases or sentences. Coordinating conjunctions are for, and, nor, but, or, yet, and so.
A subordinating conjunction is a word or phrase that combines one independent clause and one dependent clause.  Subordinating conjunctions include after, although, as, as if, because, before, how, if, since, than, though, unless, until, when, where and while.
Correlative conjunctions are conjunctions used to illustrate how two words or phrases within a sentence relate to each other. Common correlative conjunction pairs include (both/and, either/or; neither/nor, whether/not) 
Conjunctive adverbs are transition words or phrases. Conjunctive adverbs are also called connective adverbs or linking adverbs. examples of conjunctive adverbs include additionally, also, however, for example
goal_text: By 05/05/2026, given therapist selected tasks and with anchor charts as needed, Esau will demonstrate understanding and use of use of conjunctions (coordinating, subordinating, correlative, conjunctive adverbs) to construct compound and complex sentences with 80% accuracy.

baseline: 55% accuracy

goal_text: By January 28, 2026, When working in a small group of 3-4 students to complete an academic task (e.g. science experiment, math problem), Carter will use at least 1 focusing strategies (e.g. deep breathing, counting) to maintain attention and focus to complete the group task for at least 20 minutes on 3 out of 4 group academic tasks

baseline: Given a short passage and a visual cue paired with a graphic organizer, Kevin is making inferences with approximately 50% accuracy.

goal_text: By November 2024, given one visual cue and/or verbal prompt, when presented with an object or concept, Kevin will sentences of appropriate length and complexity to describe the presented stimuli using at least 5 descriptors (i.e., category, size, shape, color, texture, location, and/or actions, etc.) with 80% accuracy in 4 out of 5 opportunities.

baseline: Kevin currently requires 2-3 visual, verbal cues, leading questions, forced choices, references to complete these tasks in 75% opportunities.
goal_text: By November 2025, Kevin will independently use a semantic feature web and reference materials (internet search, thesaurus, context clues, dictionary) to discuss at least 4 semantic features (location, function, part of speech, attributes) of curriculum related vocabulary, 3x per session.

baseline: Kevin can currently make inferences given 2-3 prompts.
goal_text: By November 2025, Kevin will make expected inferences (using past experiences + context of the current situation to make an educated guess) during Idiom and social problem solving activities, given only rare verbal feedback from the clinician as leading questions or comments, in at least 80% of presented opportunities each.

baseline: Currently Kevin can read a text at a 5th grade level with 69% accuracy, however he is unable to answer comprehension questions and find the supporting evidence without adult support or corrections.
goal_text: By November 2025, after reading an independent level text, Kevin will identify the main idea from 2 multiple choices and underline 2 supporting details in the text, for with 80% accuracy, on 3 out of 4 progress monitoring assessments.

baseline: Following teacher-led pre-writing activities, when given a topic or after selecting a topic, Kevin is able to produce a correctly indented, multiple-paragraph composition that includes an introductory paragraph, at least 2 supporting paragraphs and a conclusion paragraph, in 80% of opportunities (4 of 5 trials), as measured by student work samples.
